You will learn about the importance of equality and why it is important not to assume that it means ‚Äúsameness‚Äù
You will appreciate why it is important to value diversity

items.title: Employee Retention University
items.headline: The Absolute Essentials to Achieving Elite Employee Retention Excellence
objectives_summary: Students who enroll in the class will learn the fundamentals that are integral to driving employee retention in their organization as well as practical ideas that can be immediately implemented.  Students will find that most of the techniques are either no cost or low cost.  The course will offer a systematic approach to retaining employees.  Those who take the course will realize that employee retention is simple...really simple.  The key is to use this comprehensive approach and start to use the techniques that are outlined.  Students will learn key questions to ask employees and how to determine if they have an issue with a particular employee and if they are in danger of leaving.  It is a proactive approach to get ahead of employee retention issues or a roadmap to get your employee retention back on track.

items.title: The Ultimate Job Interview Framework

visible_instructors.job_title: The Big Game Hunter helps the world find work and be great!
visible_instructors.title: Jeff Altman
visible_instructors.name: Jeff

items.headline: Prepare for interviews like no one else so you get better results than everyone else!
objectives_summary: Job interviews don't have to be hard, difficult or painful Here, you will learn how to interview so you stand out in a good way from all the people you are competing with on your interviews. I want to remind you. I can't help you be better at what you do. What I help you do is get an understanding of the job early in the interview so you can talk about what you've doe that matters to them and not just talk about what you've done. You'll learn the best way to answer, "Tell me about yourseld" to connect the dots for the interviewer so they know you fit the role quickly. Tell stories that sell your experience and great questions to ask at the end of the interview. I have a section dealing with the unique requirements of video interviews as well as what to do if the phone rings out of the blue with someone wanting to interview you. This will help you if you haven't interview in a long time or if your nerves get the better of you.
What makes you qualified to teach about interviewing?

I am a former executive recruiter with many years of experience who now is a career coach. I filled more than 1200 full time positions plus consulting assignments. I am LinkedIn member 7653, host the #1 podcast in Apple Podcasts for job search, "No BS Job Search Advice Radio," with more episodes than any other show by more than 2 to 1, and a Top rated YouTube channel on job search, too. My experience isn't theoretical. It is the experience of working to try to fill positions and hearing feedback from hiring managers and HR leaders.
